org.globalplatform.broker

Interface BrokerRequestHandler

  • All Superinterfaces:
    javacard.framework.Shareable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CDCVMBrokerRequestHandler

    public interface BrokerRequestHandler
extends javacard.framework.Shareable
    Interface implemented by an Application to handle the requests submitted by a Broker Application.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static byte SIO_BROKER_REQUEST_HANDLER
      Constant used to retrieve an implementation of this interface from an Application (0xC0).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      short handleBrokerRequest(byte[] inBuffer, short inOffset, short inLength, byte[] outBuffer, short outOffset)
      Finalizes the processing of a Broker Request.
      void initBrokerRequest(short object, short attributes, short request)
      Initializes the processing of a Broker Request.
      void updateBrokerRequest(byte[] inBuffer, short inOffset, short inLength)
      Accumulates the data of a Broker Request.

    • Field Detail

      • SIO_BROKER_REQUEST_HANDLER

        static final byte SIO_BROKER_REQUEST_HANDLER
        Constant used to retrieve an implementation of this interface from an Application (0xC0).

        This constant is a generic constant telling the Application that the requested SIO (if available) shall be of type BrokerRequestHandler. Subtypes of BrokerRequestHandler may define additional constants that should be used instead to tell the Application that a specific subtype of BrokerRequestHandler is requested. If such constants are not used and the Application implements several subtypes of BrokerRequestHandler, the Application may return null or return an object of an incorrect type (i.e. leading to a ClassCastException or other errors).

        See Also:
        JCSystem.getAppletShareableInterfaceObject(javacard.framework.AID, byte), Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • initBrokerRequest

        void initBrokerRequest(short object,
                       short attributes,
                       short request)
        Initializes the processing of a Broker Request.
        Parameters:
        object - object (e.g. entity, asset...) to which the request relates
        attributes - additional object attributes which may be used to further identify the object
        request - request specification
        Throws:
        javacard.framework.ISOException - (ISO7816.SW_FUNC_NOT_SUPPORTED) if the request is not supported or unknown to the Application.

      • updateBrokerRequest

        void updateBrokerRequest(byte[] inBuffer,
                         short inOffset,
                         short inLength)
        Accumulates the data of a Broker Request.
        Parameters:
        inBuffer - byte array containing intermediary input data
        inOffset - offset of intermediary input data
        inLength - length of intermediary input data
        Throws:
        javacard.framework.ISOException - (ISO7816.SW_CONDITIONS_NOT_SATISFIED) if the initBrokerRequest(short, short, short) method was not previously invoked, or if the caller Application is not the same as the one that last invoked the initBrokerRequest(short, short, short).
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if inBuffer is null.
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if inBuffer would be accessed out of bounds.
        java.lang.SecurityException - if inBuffer cannot be read by the Application implementing this interface.
        See Also:
        initBrokerRequest(short, short, short), JCSystem.getAID()

      • handleBrokerRequest

        short handleBrokerRequest(byte[] inBuffer,
                          short inOffset,
                          short inLength,
                          byte[] outBuffer,
                          short outOffset)
        Finalizes the processing of a Broker Request.
        Parameters:
        inBuffer - byte array containing final input data
        inOffset - offset of final input data
        inLength - length of final input data
        outBuffer - byte array where output data shall be written (if any)
        outOffset - offset of output data (if any)
        Returns:
        depending on the type of request, length of output data (if any) or specific result value
        Throws:
        javacard.framework.ISOException - (ISO7816.SW_CONDITIONS_NOT_SATISFIED) if the initBrokerRequest(short, short, short) method was not previously invoked, or if the caller Application is not the same as the one that last invoked the initBrokerRequest(short, short, short).
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if inBuffer or outBuffer is null.
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if inBuffer or outBuffer would be accessed out of bounds.
        java.lang.SecurityException - if inBuffer cannot be read or outBuffer cannot be written by the Application implementing this interface.
        See Also:
        initBrokerRequest(short, short, short), updateBrokerRequest(byte[], short, short), JCSystem.getAID()
